meanings.definition: A respectful gesture made by women, consisting of a slight bending of the knees and lowering of the body.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the princess gave a curtsey to show her respect.
meanings.sent2: She learned to curtsey gracefully at the royal ball.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's curtsey made everyone smile at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her curtsey was like a gentle nod to the queen's presence.
meanings.sent5: The ballet dancer's curtsey at the end of the performance was elegant and poised.

meanings.sent1: She will curtsey before the queen at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The young lady practiced how to curtsey properly.
meanings.sent3: He decided to curtsey playfully to his friends just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The trees seemed to curtsey in the wind's strong gusts.
meanings.sent5: The student nervously prepared to curtsey in front of the entire school.

meanings.definition: A formal gesture of greeting or respect, especially among women.
meanings.sent1: The curtsey was a traditional way to greet the royal family.
meanings.sent2: At the ball, the ladies would curtsey before entering the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: Her exaggerated curtsey drew laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The curtsey was like a silent hello to the important guests.
meanings.sent5: The elegant lady's curtsey was the perfect way to show her respect.
